# Battle of Santa Ana (1816)

United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves
| combatant2  =  Federal League
| commander1  = Alexandre Queirós
| commander2  = General Sotelo
| strength1   = Unknown
| strength2   = Unknown
| casualties1 = 60 men killed
| casualties2 = Unknown
| campaignbox =
}}
The Battle of Santa Ana took place between the Luso-Brazilian forces under the command of Alexandre Queirós in Rio Grande do Sul, modern-day Brazil.
After the Luso-Brazilian attack, oriental leader José Gervasio Artigas attempted to take the battle to the invading forces by invading Brazil. The battle lasted for 3 hours and ended with a Luso-Brazilian defeat.
